com.panviva.util.pgc.dom.processing

Class Partitioner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.panviva.util.pgc.dom.processing.Partitioner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPartitioner, ITransform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocumentPartitioner, FolderPartitioner, SectionPartitioner, TaskPartitioner

    public abstract class Partitioner
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPartitioner, ITransform
    Abstract class implementing partitioning executed under the umbrella of a transform. This class provides all the methods to perform general xHtml common object model document partitioning. For partition specific partitioning this class should be sub-classes and the appropriate methods overwritten.
    Author:
    jcharles

      • setParentContainerXPath

        public void setParentContainerXPath(java.lang.String sXPath)
        This method provides the xPath to the node or nodes the content of which will be used for partitioning. Folder partitioning is applied to siblings of this node. For Document/Section/Task/etc. partitioning, this method provides the xPath to a node or nodes whose children will be used for partitioning.
        Specified by:
        setParentContainerXPath in interface IPartitioner
        Parameters:
        sXPath - Parent Container XPath

        public org.w3c.dom.NodeList getParentContainerNodes()
                                             throws javax.xml.xpath.XPathExpressionException
        This method returns a node or nodes whose siblings for folder partitioning or children for document/section/task partitioning will be used to further partition a document.
        Specified by:

      • setParentContainerType

        public void setParentContainerType(IPartitionType type)
        This method sets the type of parent container. The parent container determines whether sibling (for folders) or child nodes (for document/section/tasks) are used to further partition a document.
        Specified by:
        setParentContainerType in interface IPartitioner
        Parameters:

      • setIntroPartitionTitle

        public void setIntroPartitionTitle(java.lang.String title)
        All information between the start and the first partition node are placed in an "Preliminaries" partition so that no information in the xHtml document is lost. This method sets the title for that partition. The default is {PartitionType} + " Preliminaries".
        Specified by:
        setIntroPartitionTitle in interface IPartitioner
        Parameters:
        title - Introductory Partition Title

      • getIntroPartitionTitle

        Returns:

      • setKeepFirstElements

        public void setKeepFirstElements(boolean keep)
        All of the child elements of the introductory partition can be preserved (true) or discarded (false). This setter method indicates whether the child content will be preserved.
        Specified by:
        setKeepFirstElements in interface IPartitioner
        Parameters:
        keep - Boolean flag to indicate if child element of the introductory partition will be preserved.
